text: Sky diving: 'The Parachute will malfunction, and I will not see my family again'
My fear is my body's response to a threat. Plus, Skydiving equipment is checked very intensely, there are 3 deployments to ensure I land safely
Public Speaking: 'I will say something bad, and everyone will think I am dumb'
Most people are wanting to learn from my content not my mistakes
Taking an Exam: 'If I get one question wrong, I'll fail the whole class'
My course grade is determined by multiple assignments. A single question does not determine my whole course grade
Job interview: 'I'll freeze up and stutter, therefore they will not hire me.'
I have prepared well, regardless if in freeze, I can recover and still make a impression
Setting boundaries: 'This person will start to hate me and not value me as a person anymore'
Healthy relationships accepts boundaries. They have encouraged me to express myself in the past
Meeting someone new: 'This person will think I am weird and socially awkward'
Everyone at this event is very friendly. Conversation here is going well, everyone gets nervous when meeting someone new
Sitting in Traffic: 'I am going to get a bad reputation with my family'
I cannot control traffic. I will advise my family about the delay, I am still attending the event
Returning purchased item: 'The employee is going to think I am poor and cheap'
Returns are part of their job description. I am allowed to return things that I did not use.
